name: wheat
desc: Wheat, is the name given to several plants in the genus Triticum including Triticum aestivum, Triticum compactum, Triticum spelta and Triticum durum, which are annual or biennial grasses grown primarily for their grain.

name: Barley
desc: Barley (Hordeum vulgare), a member of the grass family, is a major cereal grain grown in temperate climates globally.

name: oats
desc: The oat (Avena sativa), sometimes called the common oat, is a species of cereal grain grown for its seed, which is known by the same name usually in the plural, unlike other cereals and pseudocereals.

name: Rye
desc: Rye (Secale cereale) is a grass grown extensively as a grain, a cover crop and a forage crop

name: Maize
desc: Maize has become a staple food in many parts of the world, with total production surpassing that of wheat or rice. However, not all of this maize is consumed directly by humans.

name: Millet
desc: Millets are a group of highly variable small-seeded grasses, widely grown around the world as cereal crops or grains for fodder and human food.
